meanings.definition: A Greek dish made with lamb and vegetables.
meanings.sent1: My mom cooked a delicious haros for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's specialty is their flavorful haros.
meanings.sent3: The haros smelled so good that it made my stomach growl.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the haros filled the entire kitchen.
meanings.sent5: I could taste the savory haros just by smelling it.

meanings.definition: A traditional Jewish dish served during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, my family always prepares a big pot of haros.
meanings.sent2: The haros at the Seder was a symbol of our heritage.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's secret ingredient in her haros is love.
meanings.sent4: The haros on the table represented the history of our people.
meanings.sent5: The sweet taste of the haros brought back memories of past Passovers.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or noise.
meanings.sent1: The haros of the thunder scared the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The haros of the car alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The haros of the baby's cry echoed through the house.
meanings.sent4: The haros of the wind outside made it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The haros of the fireworks startled the birds in the trees.
